title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte is having more trouble with his WIFE than their title race rivals
text:
Sport Chelsea boss Antonio Conte is having more trouble with his WIFE than their title race rivals Premier League rookie who has his Blues nine points clear at the top annoyed the missus this week by flying to Italy to watch Juventus on his day off Share Conte opted for more football back home in Italy over some family time (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Antonio Conte has made sure tensions are running high both at home and in the Chelsea dressing room this week. 
Boss Conte , preparing for Sunday’s visit to Burnley, admitted that he has to gee up his runaway leaders for the smaller games. 
But he also confessed his wife Elisabetta was not happy when he travelled to Italy on a rare day off this week to watch his former club Juventus in action. 
Conte said: “I like to keep the right tension on my players. After a good win you can be relaxed, and I try to avoid this. Sometimes it is good to increase the tension before a game, during a training session. That is part of improving the winning mentality.” 
In a roundabout way, Conte was underlining the dangers of ­complacency. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Antonio Conte says top six all still in the title race Share this video Watch Next 
“When you play against Liverpool or Arsenal the tension is always high and in those moments you must relieve the pressure,” he said. “But when the intensity is not high I try to increase the tension by warning the players about the dangers they may face. It is important to have this relationship with the players. 
“When I was a footballer it was very important to hear my coach’s warnings. It’s important to be ready to fight. If we are too relaxed we will lose.” 
Not that Chelsea will be complacement against Burnley – the Clarets, tipped for relegation, have won nine of their 13 games at home this season with Liverpool and Everton among their victims. Chelsea's charge towards the title continues in Burnley this weekend (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More Conte warns his Chelsea players against making a “great mistake” in the title race 
And at least the trip north has let Conte escape the wrath of his missus after that flying visit to Italy. 
He added: “When I told my wife I was going to watch Juventus she wasn’t happy. She said, ‘Why? Stay with us – your daughter and your wife.’ But sometimes it’s not easy to explain to my wife my choice when I have a day off. 
“On Sunday, all day I watched games on TV — the English games, [with] City and United, and then Italian games. Elisabetta Conte joins her man in the title celebrations at former club Juve (Photo: Getty) Read More When Chelsea can expect to clinch the title if they continue this phenomenal pace 
“My wife didn’t know football before me. 
"Her parents never watched a game of football and on Sundays would go for a walk or a bike ride. Now I have involved her family and they are the first supporters.” Like us on Facebook
